intro: Artemisia japonica, commonly known as Japanese wormwood, is a perennial herb native to East Asia. It features silver-gray, aromatic foliage with lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers in panicles, which bloom in late summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a hardy plant suitable for gardens and landscapes. Its essential oils have been used traditionally for their medicinal and aromatic properties.
